errors.error_description: The installation command unnecessarily includes the 'selenium' package, which is a separate library and not part of the core Robot Framework installation.
correction_candidates: pip install robotframework && pip install selenium

errors.error_description: The README vaguely states 'Robot Framework runs on Python 3' but omits the specific minimum required version (Python 3.8), which can cause installation failure on older Python 3 versions.
correction_candidates: Robot Framework requires Python 3.6 or newer.
Robot Framework requires the latest version of Python 3.
Robot Framework requires Python 3.8 or newer and runs also on `PyPy <http://pypy.org>`_.
Robot Framework is compatible with all Python 3.x versions.
errors.golden_answer: Robot Framework requires Python 3.8 or newer and runs also on `PyPy <http://pypy.org>`_.

errors.error_description: The example test case references a resource file using the path 'resources/login.resource', implying a directory structure that is not mentioned or set up, which will likely cause a file not found error.
The usage example for setting a command-line variable, 'robot --variable BROWSER=Firefox', incorrectly uses an equals sign '=' instead of the required colon ':' as a separator.
